name: Archie Scott-Brown
introduction: William Archibald "Archie" Scott Brown (born 13 May 1927 and died 19 May 1958) was a British Formula One and sports car driver from Scotland. He raced with one hand due to a childhood disability. He participated in the 1956 British Grand Prix and had qualified for the 1956 Italian Grand Prix but was unable to compete due to a licence conflict.
